raw_text:
Souness eyes summer move for Owen
 
 Newcastle boss Graeme Souness is lining up a summer move for England and Real Madrid striker Michael Owen.
 
 He sees Owen as the ideal replacement for Alan Shearer, who is due to retire in the summer, although he hopes to persuade Shearer to carry on. "Michael is in the category of players who would excite the fans and we're monitoring him," he told BBC Newcastle. "He is a great centre-forward and only 25 but I don't think we're the only ones monitoring the situation at Real." Souness has also hinted he thinks Shearer may carry on despite his stated intent to retire at the end of the season. He believes the prospect of breaking Jackie Milburn's club scoring record may influence the striker's decision.
 
 Milburn scored 200 league and cup goals between 1946 and 1957, while Shearer currently has 187 goals to his name. "Without giving too much away, I am confident he will be here next season," said Souness. "I can't imagine him leaving without breaking Jackie Milburn's scoring record." Souness also revealed he tried to bring back Nolberto Solano during the January transfer window. The Peruvian international was sold to Aston Villa a year ago but in the phone-in for BBC Newcastle, Souness said tried to re-sign him, but Villa were not interested in selling.
 
 The former Rangers and Liverpool boss is also looking to bring in a number of new acquisitions once the current campaign has been completed. "I'm after three, four or five new players in the summer - we have got lots of targets," he said. "Don't think we will wait to the last day of the season to say: `Who are we going to target now?"'
llama3.2:1b: Graeme Souness is considering a move for Michael Owen due to his potential replacement for Alan Shearer, who is set to retire. Souness believes Owen has the ability to excite fans and wants him to stay with Newcastle. He also thinks Shearer may continue despite saying he intends to retire at the end of the season.

Souness also tried to re-sign Nolberto Solano during the January transfer window but was unsuccessful.

Souness attempted to re-sign Nolberto Solano during the January transfer window but was unsuccessful. Souness plans to recruit three to five new players in the summer.

Also, he plans to bring in new acquisitions such as Nolberto Solano and potentially some players from Aston Villa that the Peruvian international was sold to, in his summer moves.

He also hints that Shearer might extend his career despite retiring at the end of the season due to breaking Jackie Milburn's club scoring record. Souness also discusses trying to bring in new players before the campaign concludes, mentioning a desire to add three to five players during the transfer window.

Souness believes Shearer may stay at Newcastle, possibly influenced by breaking Jackie Milburn's scoring record. Despite this, Souness has also hinted he will try to re-sign Nolberto Solano from Aston Villa. He is set to bring in three to five new players in the summer, not waiting until the end of the season.
opencoder:1.5b:
Summarizing the following text:

Souness looks forward to a summer move with the team and finds Owen an appealing replacement.

Owen, a mid-range forward with only 25 years left, is known for his exceptional attacking skills and forward-thinking personality. He has scored a league and cup record of 200 goals in the club's match history. Despite the prospect of breaking Milburn's scoring record, Souness believes Owen will be ready to play the season. Additionally, Souness hints that Shearer may continue despite his stated intention to retire.

Souness also shows a keen eye for a talented Peruvian international during the January transfer window and has tried to bring back Nolberto Solano during the campaign. Despite Villa's interest in selling, Owen has been an effective defender for them as they have shown consistency and potential in defending themselves.
smollm:1.7b: Owen is looking for a replacement for Alan Shearer who would be suitable for England and Real Madrid striker Michael Owen. He believes Owen may carry on despite his stated intent to retire at the end of the season. He thinks that breaking Jackie Milburn's scoring record may influence Owen's decision.

Souness is also hoping that Milburn's record of scoring 200 league goals between 1946 and 1957 may influence Shearer's decision to continue playing.

granite3.1-dense:2b:
Newcastle United manager Graeme Souness is considering a summer transfer for England and Real Madrid striker Michael Owen, who could potentially replace retiring star Alan Shearer. Souness believes Owen, at 25, would excite fans and is not the only club monitoring his situation. Despite Shearer's stated intent to retire, Souness is optimistic he'll stay, motivated by the chance to surpass Jackie Milburn's record of 200 league and cup goals. Shearer currently holds 187 goals.

Souness also attempted to re-sign Peruvian Nolberto Solano during January but was unsuccessful due to Aston Villa's reluctance to sell. For the upcoming season, Souness aims to sign three to five new players, indicating a proactive transfer strategy.
